original: Hyllner, Oskar Magnus, kyrkoherde, kontraktsprost, Kungsbacka, f. 12/9/88 i Tryde, Krist. 1. — Stud:ex. i Lund 14, teol. fil. ex. 15, _ teol. kand. 18, prakt. teol. ex. o. prästv. 18. Älvsåkers kyrkostämmor o. ’barnav:-ndn i Lindome 23-30, i Tölö t. 32 o. i Älvsåker t. 33, led. av Tölö komm:-fulilm. 24-33 o. fr. .39, ordf. i Töllö-Lindome o. Älvs åkers skoktyr. sed. 32, i sitift. translated: Hyllner, Oskar Magnus, pastor, dean, Kungsbacka, b. 12/9/88 in Tryde, Krist. 1. — Graduated from Lund with a high school diploma in 1914, a bachelor's degree in theology in 1915, a theological candidate's degree in 1918, a practical theology exam and ordination in 1918. Travelled to Germany, Italy, Austria and Switzerland. Deputy Pastor in Köpinge Parish from 1920, Acting Vicar in Hesslunda from 1920-1923, Vicar in Tölö, Lindome and Älvsåker Parishes from 1923, Dean of Fjäre and Viske deaneries from 1934. Chairman of Tölö, Lindome and Älvsåkers church councils and the children's committee in Lindome from 1923-1930, in Tölö in 1932 and in Älvsåker in 1933. Member of the Tölö municipal council from 1924-1933 and again from 1939, chairman of the Tölö-Lindome and Älvsåkers school boards from 1932, at Annelberg home for the elderly in Gbg from 1936 and in the Tölö and Älvsåkers Red Cross districts from 1941. Member of the board of directors of Hall. 1. Children's Committee and VaWdaheimnüet Association, member of the Epilepsy Board from 1930 and the Swedish Church's Missionary Board from 1932. Received the Order of Vasa in 1944. Hyltén-Cavallius, Björn Gösta, cavalry captain, Torne, b. 29/1/94 in Stockholm to Colonel and Chief of the Kronoborg Regiment Gösta H-C and Anna Astrup. Married Harriet Lundquist in 1921. Children: Gunlög b. 1922, married to forest ranger Hans Hartelius; Elsa b. 1923, married to inspector Fabian af Petersens; Björn b. 1926, student; Gösta b. 1928, student; Hans b. 1938, student. Attended Lundberg school, graduated in 1915. Entered the Småland Hussar Regiment in 1917, promoted to Second Lieutenant in 1919, and to Lieutenant in the Royal Life Guards in 1928. Became a cavalry captain in 1932. Owns and runs Sunnanviks estate. Chairman of the Kronoborg Forest Association and the Southeast Swedish Forestry Association. Knight of the Royal Order of the Sword.
